title: Fact Check: Here’s what is written on her placard | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
After some Tablighi Jamaat attendees, under quarantine in Ghaziabad’s MMG Hospital, were accused of allegedy found roaming inside the hospital premises without clothes, a picture post of a girl holding a placard surfaced on the internet.

The text on the placard read: “सच पूछो तो वो नर्सों के सामने निर्वस्त्र नहीं हो रहे हैं बल्कि उनका मजहब पूरे विश्व के सामने निर्वस्त्र हो रहा है”

ALSO READ: NO! These pictures are not of Ethiopian Airline plane crash

NewsMobile fact-checked the picture and found that the viral picture is morphed.

When we put the image through Reverse Image Search, we found that the picture was from a campaign One Beauty of Islam at the University of Mary Washington in Virginia.

We came across a blog post dated May 30, 2012, which had all the pictures from the campaign.

As you can see in the above picture, the text on the placard read: “I’m a Muslim but I’m not Arab”. “DON’T STEREOTYPE ME UMW INA CAMPAIGN” was also written in block letters.

Hence, the above information proves that the picture is morphed.

If you want to fact-check any story, WhatsApp it now on +91 88268 00707
